Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 12:58PM penny3333 wrote: Hi ga, my hair was down below my waist when I started this. I didn't want to do chemo at all, it killed my dad and I didn't want that to happen to me. My oncologist said my tumor was very aggressive (it was a 53 on the KI67 scale). So, I said ok. My first hair cut, I donated it for a wig. I thought I would be able to wait until a few weeks after I started chemo before I'd have to shave my head. It was less than a week after my first AC that it started coming out in clumps. After one shower I looked like a warewolf, so I had it shaved. In less than a week I was totally bald. It's growing back now and I look like a poodle having a bad hair day. The one thing I learned through all of this is appreciation for every day of life. I am greatful that I have the chance to complain about the way I look and what it did to my hair. What I pray for is enough time to grow it back to the length it was and hope that one day it will look as good as it did. The decision is yours, you will have support from your loved ones, no matter what you decide. Make sure you are doing the best for your chances of survival. Who knows, maybe one day there will actually be a cure. The longer we're around, the better chance we'll have of finding it! Best wishes!

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 01:53PM penny3333 wrote: I had Adriaycin with Cytoxin. It was rough for me, but I was told by my oncologist that I was a rare case. I had a MUGA scan before I started which he said was 85%. They did another one before I started my Taxol/Herceptin which showed 68%. So it did do something to my heart, but it's still in normal range, so I guess it's ok. You need to know what the benefits to you will be, what your recurrance rate will be with/without it, and get a second opinion if necessary to help you make up your mind. I talked to my surgeon and radiation oncologist, then made up my mind. Best wishes!
